definitions: To fight with the fists, especially as a preliminary to a boxing match or as a form of training.
To make the motions of boxing without landing heavy blows, as in practice.
To engage in a dispute or argument, especially a good-natured one.
To strike or fight with spurs, as cocks do.
To engage in a mock fight or argument.
To contend or dispute in a lively, good-natured way.
examples: The boxers sparred for several rounds.
They sparred over the last piece of cake.
The two politicians sparred during the debate.
He likes to spar with his friends.
The young roosters sparred in the yard.
